data.title: What examples of irony are there in White Fang?
data.meta_description: One example of irony in "White Fang" is that the wild and savage White Fang eventually becomes more domesticated and civilized as he learns to trust and love his human companions. Another example is when the man who initially abused White Fang, Beauty Smith, ends up being defeated and humiliated by White Fang in a fight. These instances highlight the unexpected and opposite outcomes that occur throughout the novel.
data.text: One example of irony in "White Fang" is that the wild and savage White Fang eventually becomes more domesticated and civilized as he learns to trust and love his human companions.
